name: Food & Drink Photography
reviews: I really enjoyed 'Ghost Fleet', and was looking forward to another novel in that vein. This was by far one of the worst techno-thrillers I've ever read. Shoddy characters  the book lacks convincing technical detail, and is horribly inconsistent with the technologies that it portrays.

name: Advertising Photography.
reviews: This book seems to be trying to achieve two things. The first is to be a 'wake-up' call to the general public about how unprepared America is for a confrontation with a technologically superior, determined China, its probably designed to help stimulate thought about

name: Event Photography.
reviews: I've read negative comments on this book, and agree some of those points are valid, and yet I give this book five stars and urge voters and those in positions to set policy to read it.The gist and ultimate message of the book is what we should take away.

name: Cookbook Photography
reviews: After reading this book, I had to look up who Adm Stavridis actually was and as hard it is to believe he was a NATO Supreme Allied Commander Europe, which frankly explains the European reluctance to support NATO.

name: restaurant & Hospitality Photography
reviews: The Chinese are technologically advanced to the point that it can remotely hijack an F-35 in mid-air and block all communications between US ships that can see each other, but its Minister of Defense is detestably fat and can't afford a tailor to make him a fit uniform;

name: Erdogan
reviews: saw the authors in an interview and was immedatly interested in this book. I am 60 and don't often read novels for pleasure, but after reading the sample I was enjoying the book. Howver, From the sample and into the book the use of Chirst and variants to curse were all too common. I am sorry to see that. I really wrestled with wanting to contiue
